statement.tex: \text{A stone is dropped into a quiet lake and}\\ \text{waves move in circles at the speed of}\\ \text{5 cm/s. At the instant when radius of the }\\ \text{circular wave is 8cm, how fast is the }\\ \text{enclosed area increasing?}
\\ \text{If R = radius of the wave at time = T and}\\ \text{A = enclosed area, then we have to find?}

reason.tex: \text{We have been given }\frac{dR}{dT}=5\text{ cm/s}.\\ \text{And we need to find }\frac{dA}{dT}.
\text{The enclosed area would be }A=\pi\cdot R^2.\text{And hence,}\\ \frac{dA}{dT} = \pi\cdot\frac{d}{dR}R^2\cdot\frac{dR}{dT}= 2\pi\cdot R\frac{dR}{dT}.
